page.title: 12THE BRECHIN BY-PASS
page.content: The by-pass was opened in I976. It follows a route to the north-west of the town. Its total length of 4 miles incorporates 4 bridges and 2 pairs of lay-bys. Its average width is 9.3 metres. The removal of through- traffic from the streets of Brechin has made the centre less dangerous, less noisy, less polluted and less congested. A survey , on a typical weekday morning, showed that traffic was using the by-pass at the rate of 550 vehicles an hour. 34% of this flow consisted of lorries heading to and from the thriving oil city of Aberdeen. Cars accounted for 58% of the flow and buses, vans, tractors and motorcycles made up the rest. Although good quality farmland was used up and a petrol station on the old road closed down most of the community has benefited from this transport addition
